state.code:
sequenceDiagram
    participant browser
    participant server

browser->>server: POST https://studies.cs.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/new_note
Note right of browser: Submits the form wich contains action "/new_note" and method (request HTTP) "POST". Data is sent as the body of the POST request.
server-->>browser: URL redirect request
Note left of server: The server asks the browser to do a new HTTP GET request to the address "notes".
browser->>server: GET https://studies.cs.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/notes
Note right of browser: Browser gets it...
server-->>browser: HTML document
Note left of server: ...and reloads. This causes three more HTTP requests.
browser->>server: GET https://studies.cs.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/main.css
Note right of browser: Links in the HTML code cause the browser to also fetch the CSS style sheet main.css...
server-->>browser: CSS file
browser->>server: GET https://studies.cs.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/main.js
Note right of browser: ...and the JavaScript code file main.js.
server-->>browser: JavaScript file
Note left of server: The browser executes the JavaScript code...
browser->>server: GET https://studies.cs.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/data.json
Note right of browser: ...and fetches the JSON file from the server.
server-->>browser: [["notes":"note1", "note2"],...]
Note left of server: When the data has been fetched, the browser executes an event handler, which renders the notes to the page using the DOM-API.
